channel.title: Making a Godwars Killcount interface [NON] renamed

item.title: Making a Godwars Killcount interface [NON] renamed
item.dc:creator: @Berky-Scape Berky-Scape
item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:17, topic:285032”][quote author=lover854 link=topic=376716.msg3127857#msg3127857 date=1266175865]
Thnx repped

berky how do i make this work with a working kc for my godwars?
[/quote]

ill tell you

ok, notice these parts of code in his interface

addText(16216, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//armadyl
addText(16217, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//bandos
addText(16218, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//saradomin
addText(16219, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//zamorak

those are the 0’s after the zammy kills, bandos kills, etc…
the 16216 - 16219 are the sendquest id’s

so you would do

sendFrame126(BandosKillCount, 16217);

Note: do not copy and paste that code expecting it to work, that is a simple demonstration on how you would make the 0’s change in number[/quote]

The whole topic is a little bit old I will edit it, and make the words more tinier.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a Godwars Killcount interface [NON] renamed
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“lover854, post:16, topic:285032”]Thnx repped

berky how do i make this work with a working kc for my godwars?[/quote]

ill tell you

ok, notice these parts of code in his interface

addText(16216, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//armadyl
addText(16217, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//bandos
addText(16218, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//saradomin
addText(16219, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//zamorak

those are the 0’s after the zammy kills, bandos kills, etc…
the 16216 - 16219 are the sendquest id’s

so you would do

sendFrame126(BandosKillCount, 16217);

Note: do not copy and paste that code expecting it to work, that is a simple demonstration on how you would make the 0’s change in number

item.title: Making a Godwars Killcount interface [NON] renamed
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

You can make the interface code a lot shorter.

public static void GodWars(TextDrawingArea[] wid) {
	RSInterface Tab = addTab(16210);
	addText(16211, "NPC killcount", wid, 1, 0xff9040);
	addText(16212, "Armadyl kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040);
	addText(16213, "Bandos kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040);
	addText(16214, "Saradomin kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040);
	addText(16215, "Zamorak kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040);
	addText(16216, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//armadyl
	addText(16217, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//bandos
	addText(16218, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//saradomin
	addText(16219, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//zamorak
	Tab.isMouseoverTriggered = false;
	Tab.totalChildren(9, 9, 9);
	Tab.child(0, 16211, -52+375, 7);
	Tab.child(1, 16212, -52+374, 30);
	Tab.child(2, 16213, -52+372, 44);
	Tab.child(3, 16214, -52+381, 58);
	Tab.child(4, 16215, -52+375, 73);
	Tab.child(5, 16216, -52+455, 31);
	Tab.child(6, 16217, -52+455, 45);
	Tab.child(7, 16218, -52+455, 59);
	Tab.child(8, 16219, -52+455, 74);
}
	public void totalChildren(int t) {
		children = new int[t];
		childX = new int[t];
		childY = new int[t];
	}
	public void child(int id, int interID, int x, int y) {
		children[id] = interID;
		childX[id] = x;
		childY[id] = y;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Making a Godwars Killcount interface [NON] renamed
item.dc:creator: @Berky-Scape Berky-Scape
item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

This tut is about how to make a Godwars killcount on right corner of your client screen.

Used files Class9.java, texture.java , client.java.

Open up your class9 in your client folder.

Add this first in class9 if you don’t have it:

public static void addText(int id, String text, Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4 wid[], int idx, int color) { Class9 Tab = addTab(id); Tab.anInt250 = id; Tab.anInt236 = id; Tab.anInt262 = 4; Tab.anInt217 = 0; Tab.anInt220 = 174; Tab.anInt267 = 11; Tab.anInt214 = 0; Tab.aByte254 = 0; Tab.anInt230 = -1; Tab.aBoolean223 = false; Tab.aBoolean268 = true; Tab.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_243 = wid[idx]; Tab.aString248 = text; Tab.aString228 = ""; Tab.anInt232 = color; Tab.anInt219 = 0; Tab.anInt216 = 0; Tab.anInt239 = 0; }

Add this method in it.
Search for “public static void” and add it somewhere after a bracket.

public static void GodWars(Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4[] wid) { Class9 Tab = addTab(16210); addText(16211, "NPC killcount", wid, 1, 0xff9040); addText(16212, "Armadyl kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040); addText(16213, "Bandos kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040); addText(16214, "Saradomin kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040); addText(16215, "Zamorak kills", wid, 1, 0xff9040); addText(16216, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//armadyl addText(16217, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//bandos addText(16218, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//saradomin addText(16219, "0", wid, 1, 0x66FFFF);//zamorak Tab.aBoolean266 = false; Tab.anIntArray240 = new int[9]; Tab.anIntArray241 = new int[9]; Tab.anIntArray272 = new int[9]; Tab.anIntArray240[0] = 16211; Tab.anIntArray241[0] = -52+375; Tab.anIntArray272[0] = 7; Tab.anIntArray240[1] = 16212; Tab.anIntArray241[1] = -52+374; Tab.anIntArray272[1] = 30; Tab.anIntArray240[2] = 16213; Tab.anIntArray241[2] = -52+372; Tab.anIntArray272[2] = 44; Tab.anIntArray240[3] = 16214; Tab.anIntArray241[3] = -52+381; Tab.anIntArray272[3] = 58; Tab.anIntArray240[4] = 16215; Tab.anIntArray241[4] = -52+375; Tab.anIntArray272[4] = 73; Tab.anIntArray240[5] = 16216; Tab.anIntArray241[5] = -52+455; Tab.anIntArray272[5] = 31; Tab.anIntArray240[6] = 16217; Tab.anIntArray241[6] = -52+455; Tab.anIntArray272[6] = 45; Tab.anIntArray240[7] = 16218; Tab.anIntArray241[7] = -52+455; Tab.anIntArray272[7] = 59; Tab.anIntArray240[8] = 16219; Tab.anIntArray241[8] = -52+455; Tab.anIntArray272[8] = 74; }

After search for:

aclass44 = class44

or

aclass44 = aclass44

under it add:

GodWars(aclass30_sub2_sub1_sub4);

Server sided:

Search for:

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

Under it add:

public int ArmadylkillCount = 0; public int BandoskillCount = 0; public int SarakillCount = 0; public int ZammykillCount = 0;

If you wan’t it to use like an interface, us this:

setInterfaceWalkable(16210);

Open up texthandler in your server folder and add this in it:

c.sendQuest(" 0", 16216); c.sendQuest(" 0", 16217); c.sendQuest(" 0", 16218); c.sendQuest(" 0", 16219); c.sendQuest(" NPC killcount", 16211); c.sendQuest(" Armadyl kills:", 16212); c.sendQuest(" Bandos kills:", 16213); c.sendQuest(" Saradomin kills:", 16214); c.sendQuest(" Zamorak kills:", 16215);

You’re done!
Post any errors here!

Result:

Credits:
Blood Isle
Berky
Ncarug02

Read full topic
